definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap

sentences.english: A rope, cord, or cable used to steady, guide, or secure something.
sentences.chinese: 支索一種用來固定，引導，綁縛某物的。

sentences.english: And binding with briars my joys & desires.
sentences.chinese: 用波折綁縛着我的歡娛和慾望。

sentences.english: Dhains shall He break, for the slave is our brother.
sentences.chinese: 衪將砸碎鎖鏈兒，因是咱們的兄弟受綁縛。

sentences.english: The tablets are fastened together with hoops of golden-colored alloy suspended from a rod of the same material. So much for the material appearance.
sentences.chinese: 石板被綁縛在一路，用的是雷同材料的金黃色的合金。

sentences.english: They are attached to wires above the vines that provide support for the grape bearing shoots.
sentences.chinese: 枝條和其上方的鉛絲綁縛在一起，爲嫩芽提供支撐。

sentences.english: Iraq is bandaging its wounds, and terrorism continues to kill people there.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克在綁縛傷口，那兒的恐怖主義仍在殺戮人民。

sentences.english: An entire kit can be strapped into the back of a pickup.
sentences.chinese: 一整套裝備箱可以綁縛在一輛小卡車上。

sentences.english: This dress is tight on me.
sentences.chinese: 緊身的外衣很不舒服的綁縛着。

definition: to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
to be in charge of something specific
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
